DANC 100.courseDesc: This course will include lecture, reading assignments, writing assignments and self-reflection activities to introduce students to academic dance coursework in higher education.
DANC 100.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 102.courseDesc: The physical and intellectual study of the ancient practice of yoga. Includes both physical practice and readings related to the discipline, as well as a survey of a variety of forms of the practice.
DANC 102.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 102.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 12 credits

DANC 104.courseDesc: Introduces ballet dance vocabulary including alignment, stretching and strengthening, line, flexibility and movement phrases.
DANC 104.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 104.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits

DANC 105.courseDesc: Introduces modern dance vocabulary, including stretching and strengthening exercises, alignment, movement phrases, and basic locomotor skills. Includes performances and discussion.
DANC 105.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 105.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits

DANC 106.courseDesc: Introduces jazz dance style, concentrating on body isolations, movement vocabulary and the development of movement phrases.
DANC 106.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 106.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits

DANC 107.courseDesc: Introduces hip-hop dance technique, vocabulary, movement principles, muscle control, and body alignment. Includes appreciation for funk and hip-hop with historical and cultural contexts.
DANC 107.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 107.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits

DANC 108.courseDesc: A studio course in creative movement. Uses contact and structured improvisational problems, interaction between dances and the elements of time, space and force.
DANC 108.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 108.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits

DANC 109.courseDesc: This studio course is designed to explore the aesthetic, movement, music and rituals found in African Dance forms.
DANC 109.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 109.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits

DANC 114.courseDesc: Philadelphia Dance Let's Go! exposes students to a variety of dance performance opportunities available in the Philadelphia region. Through research, discussion, and attendance at dance productions, students will enhance their abilities to discuss, evaluate and enjoy dance.
DANC 114.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 114.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC 115.courseDesc: A studio and classroom course. Examines the elements of dance through study and participation in classical, theatrical, and social forms. Includes readings, films, and discussion.
DANC 115.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 116.courseDesc: This course explores areas of health, fitness and wellness, including nutrition, cardiovascular health, strength training, flexibility, psychological wellness, and injury prevention. Topics will be covered through a combination of kinesthetic and academic approaches.
DANC 116.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 117.fullName: Foundations of Somatic Theory and Practice
DANC 117.courseDesc: This course, for beginner through advanced, teaches you to maximize your potential for dance, sports, yoga, martial arts or any movement practice, through readings, exercises and assignments that build core strength, flexibility and efficient action.
DANC 117.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 131.courseDesc: Provides practical experience as a dancer in a Department of Performing Arts dance production. Includes helping with preperformance production, attending all rehearsals, and performing in the concerts. May be repeated for credit.
DANC 131.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 131.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC 132.courseDesc: Provides practical experience in dance production, including participation in publicity, costume construction, lighting design, box office, and program production for a Drexel University Dance Ensemble concert. May be repeated for credit.
DANC 132.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 132.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC 133.courseDesc: Covers the process of developing an idea into a finished dance through close work with the artistic director, including selecting dancers and music; teaching the movement; planning costumes, lighting, and sets; polishing the work; and presenting it to an audience during a Drexel University Dance Ensemble concert. May be repeated for credit.
DANC 133.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 133.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC 135.courseDesc: Covers rhythmic structures that can accompany dance, including sight reading and eurhythmics.
DANC 135.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 204.courseDesc: Studio course in intermediate level ballet technique. Further develops students' alignment, line, muscular stamina, flexibility, movement vocabulary and artistry.
DANC 204.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 204.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits
DANC 204.prereqs: DANC 104 [Min Grade D] or DANC 140 [Min Grade D]

DANC 205.courseDesc: Covers advanced modern dance vocabulary including stretching and strengthening exercises, alignment, movement phrases and performance quality.
DANC 205.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 205.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits
DANC 205.prereqs: DANC 105 [Min Grade D] or DANC 150 [Min Grade D]

DANC 206.courseDesc: Covers advanced jazz dance style, concentrating on body isolations, movement vocabulary, and the development of movement phrases, syncopation and flexibility.
DANC 206.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 206.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits
DANC 206.prereqs: DANC 106 [Min Grade D] or DANC 160 [Min Grade D]

DANC 207.courseDesc: Advanced hip-hop dance technique, vocabulary, movement principles, muscle control, and body alignment. Includes appreciation for funk and hip-hop with historical and cultural contexts.
DANC 207.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 207.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits
DANC 207.prereqs: DANC 107 [Min Grade D] or DANC 170 [Min Grade D]

DANC 208.courseDesc: A studio course in advanced creative movement. Uses improvisational problems and improvisational dance making to study momentum, speed, alignment, contact, sound, group work, and dramatic intention.
DANC 208.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 208.prereqs: DANC 108 [Min Grade D] or DANC 180 [Min Grade D]

DANC 209.courseDesc: This studio course is an advanced exploration of the aesthetic, movement, music and rituals found in African Dance forms. It builds on principles of African I and introduces more complex and physically demanding repertory.
DANC 209.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 209.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits
DANC 209.prereqs: DANC 109 [Min Grade D] or DANC 190 [Min Grade D]

DANC 215.courseDesc: Teaches students to look at dance as an art form, emphasizing the ability to analyze and understand various dance styles. Includes films, readings, performances, and discussion.
DANC 215.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 216.courseDesc: This course introduces the principles of movement analysis by Rudolph Von Laban including an exploration of effort - shape, space and body as introduced by physical therapist Irmgard Bartenieff.
DANC 216.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 221.fullName: Survey of Dance and Movement Therapy
DANC 221.courseDesc: This course investigates the use of dance as a diagnostic and therapeutic tool for psychological health and recovery.
DANC 221.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 222.courseDesc: This course explores the social and physical development of children as it relates to the teaching of dance. Develops a repertoire of techniques for teaching children and adults.
DANC 222.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 223.fullName: Dance Pedagogy I: Foundations of Dance Pedagogy
DANC 223.courseDesc: This course explores the theoretical foundations for dance teaching and learning. Teaching methodologies and practices will be developed through academic and embodied coursework.
DANC 223.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 225.courseDesc: This course allows dancers to synthesize their technical abilities with their knowledge of dance history as they learn the works of major historical choreographers.
DANC 225.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 225.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 6 credits

DANC 235.courseDesc: Explores the basic traditional forms of solo and group composition through improvisation, manipulation of movement phrases and critique.
DANC 235.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 250.courseDesc: This course is a practical introduction to Screendance for dancemakers interested in extending their experience in dance into a new technological realm. Screendance connects film (and filmmaking) with dance (and dancemaking) in an evolving hybrid performative practice. Through creative projects, students will develop their cinematic style and increase proficiency with both filming and editing movement.
DANC 250.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 250.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC 260.courseDesc: This course uses physical and intellectual exploration to create individual flexibility and injury prevention plans that meet the student's goals. It is particularly targeted to dancers who use their bodies intensively. Techniques for injury prevention and recovery are emphasized.
DANC 260.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 304.courseDesc: Studio course in advanced level ballet technique. Further develops students' alignment, line, muscular stamina, flexibility, movement vocabulary, artistry and critical analysis of ballet movement.
DANC 304.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 304.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits
DANC 304.prereqs: DANC 204 [Min Grade D] or DANC 141 [Min Grade D]

DANC 305.courseDesc: This course covers advanced modern dance vocabulary, including stretching and strengthening exercises, alignment principles, movement phrases, and increasingly complex locomotor skills.
DANC 305.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 305.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 7 times for 16 credits
DANC 305.prereqs: DANC 205 [Min Grade D] or DANC 151 [Min Grade D]

DANC 306.courseDesc: This course covers advanced jazz dance styles for highly experienced students, concentrating on body isolations, movement vocabulary and the development of movement phrases, syncopation and flexibility.
DANC 306.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 306.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 8 credits
DANC 306.prereqs: DANC 206 [Min Grade D] or DANC 161 [Min Grade D]

DANC 307.courseDesc: Advanced Hip-Hop choreography & dance technique, movement principles, muscle control, and body alignment. Hip-Hop III includes exploring choreographic phrases and compositions like those featured in music videos, movies, and other professional presentations of Hip Hop dance.
DANC 307.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 307.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC 309.courseDesc: This studio course is designed to explore, embody and create through projects the aesthetic, movement, music, and cultural rituals found in African dance forms.
DANC 309.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 315.courseDesc: Covers the history of Western theatrical dance from the beginning of the century to contemporary times. Emphasizes the development of modern dance in the United States. Includes films, performances, and discussion. This is a writing intensive course.
DANC 315.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 316.courseDesc: This course will provide an introduction to the musculoskeletal system and basic health information. Students will gain an understanding of anatomy and kinesiology and will explore how these topics are related to dance, normal daily activities, injury prevention, and healthy lifestyle choices. The kinesiological concepts presented in this course will be applied using the context of dance movement.
DANC 316.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 323.fullName: Dance Pedagogy II: Dance Education for Children and Youth
DANC 323.courseDesc: This course explores the theoretical and practical issues surrounding dance teaching and learning for children and youth in PK-8, private studio and community engaged settings.
DANC 323.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 335.courseDesc: This course explores the advanced forms of solo or group choreography including narrative, abstract and musical interactions.
DANC 335.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 335.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits
DANC 335.prereqs: DANC 235 [Min Grade D] or DANC 240 [Min Grade D]

DANC 415.courseDesc: This course is designed to introduce students to the concepts of aesthetics which affect the ways in which dance in created, performed and viewed. Issues of dance criticism and how this pertains to aesthetic judgment will also be addressed.
DANC 415.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 415.prereqs: DANC 215 [Min Grade D] or DANC 201 [Min Grade D]

DANC 416.courseDesc: This course investigates a range of integrative mind/body practices for physical well-being and optimal performance.
DANC 416.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 416.prereqs: (DANC 316 [Min Grade D] or DANC 360 [Min Grade D]) and (DANC 117 [Min Grade D] or DANC 261 [Min Grade D])

DANC 423.fullName: Dance Pedagogy III: Dance Education for Adolescents and Adults
DANC 423.courseDesc: This course explores the theoretical and practical issues surrounding dance teaching and learning for adolescents, adults and senior adults in secondary education, private studio and community engaged settings.
DANC 423.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 481.courseDesc: Senior Seminar prepares graduating Dance students for a successful transition after graduation and provide strategies to contribute to the field of dance. This course will also prepare students for a culminating senior project experience.
DANC 481.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

DANC 491.courseDesc: Senior Project is the capstone course for Dance Majors in which the student presents a project in one of three areas: a presentation, scholarly research paper, or a major performance. The students will be required to utilize the skills, techniques, and concepts that they learned prior to their senior year in Drexel's Dance Program and present a project that reflects the students’ strength, concentration, and passion.
DANC 491.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC 491.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 3 credits

DANC I199.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
DANC I199.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC I199.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC I299.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
DANC I299.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC I299.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC I399.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
DANC I399.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC I399.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC I499.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
DANC I499.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC I499.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC T180.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
DANC T180.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC T180.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC T280.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.\.
DANC T280.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC T280.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC T380.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC T380.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

DANC T480.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
DANC T480.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
